title: Computer Organization vs Architecture
subject: Computer Organization
theory:
| Feature | Architecture | Organization |
|---|---|---|
| **View** | Programmer's View | Hardware Designer's View |
| **Focus** | What machine does | How it is implemented |
| **Components** | Instruction Set, Registers, Addressing Modes | Adders, Multipliers, Bus freq |
| **Transparency** | Visible to Programmer | Transparent (Hidden) |

interview_questions.question: Can two computers have same Architecture but different Organization?
interview_questions.answer: Yes. e.g., Intel i3 and i7 share x86 Architecture (run same code) but have different internal Organization (Cache size, Pipeline depth).
